meanings.definition: A person who habitually finds fault or criticizes.
meanings.sent1: My aunt is always a faultfinder, never seeing the good in anything.
meanings.sent2: The faultfinders in the group always have something negative to say.
meanings.sent3: The faultfinder at the party made everyone laugh with their constant complaints.
meanings.sent4: She was a faultfinder, picking apart every detail like a detective solving a case.
meanings.sent5: The faultfinder's critical eye never missed a single mistake.

meanings.sent1: He would faultfinders every little mistake in the report.
meanings.sent2: She faultfinders in order to improve the quality of her work.
meanings.sent3: The child loved to faultfinders in his friends' drawings, always finding something to fix.
meanings.sent4: The supervisor faultfinders diligently, ensuring the project was flawless.
meanings.sent5: They would faultfinders until everything was perfect, never settling for less.
